item.title: L1 Homework
item.description: Package | p.6, 7 Try and answer the following questions by yourself. If you can’t get the answer: click on the tip, or resort to checking the answers. 1) For each of the functions below: Underline a complete cycle Trace the mid line Indicate the period and amplitude of the function Tip Recognize the vocabulary of periodic functions: Cycle: A complete series of y values (peak to peak/trough to trough) Period: The horizontal distance between the beginning of the cycle and the end Amplitude: Vertical distance between the middle of the graph and the peak/trough of the function Midline: Horizontal line that passes through the middle of the graph Phase shift: Horizontal translation of graph Blank y=8sin[30(x)]−2 Blankleft Answer aaaaaa Blank y=5sin[60(x+2)]+7 Blankleft Answer aaaaaa 2) Indicate if each statement is true or false.

item.title: L4 Homework
item.description: Textbook | p.388, 39012-16 The water depth in a harbor is 21m at high tide and 11m at low tide. One cycle is completed approximately every 12h. a) Find an equation for the water depth as a function of the time, t hours, after low tide.

item.title: Notes
item.description: L1: Periodic Functions Notes What is a periodic function? A periodic function is a function in which the values of y repeat at regular intervals of θ.

item.title: L1 - Pascal's Triangle
item.description: Notes What is Pascal's Triangle? Pascal’s Triangle is a triangle formed by adding adjacent numbers from the previous rows to form the numbers below them ...

item.title: L2 - Binomial Theory
item.description: Notes Binomial Observations Coefficients: When a binomial is raised to a power, it’s coefficient corresponds to the values of a specific row. n=row (x+y)n Example (x+y)3=x3+3x2y+3xy2+y3 Coefficients=1,3,3,1 *Corresponds to 4th row of pascals triangle Exponents: When a binomial is raised to a power, it’s exponents approaches towards, or recedes away from n x→exponents decrease (n to 0) y→exponents increase (0 to n) Example (x+y)3=y0x3+3x2y1+3x1y2+x0y3 x exponents=0,1,2,3 y exponents=3,2,1,0 Binomial Theory (a+b)n=(0n​)an+(1n​)an−1b1+(2n​)an−2b2+...+(n−1n​)abn−1+(nn​)bn a diminishes from n to 0 b increases from 0 until it reaches n r increases from 0 until it reaches n There are n+1 terms in total The coefficient of a term is given by tn,r​ and n​Cr​ The sum of the exponents of a and b is the row n Questions Example 1 TL;DR Binomial Theorem Example 2 Tip Determine n Determine value of first term (a) Determine value of last term (b) Write the following expression under the form (a+b)n 1−10x2+40x4−80x6+80x8−32x10 Faq (1−2x2)5 Example 3 Tip Determine the exponent of a and b Apply all exponents Determine the coefficient (n​Cr​) Multiply everything together Determine the 4th term in the development of (2x+5y)7 Answer 70000x4y3 Your Turn! Develop and simplify (3x+4)4 Tip Binomial Theorem Answer 81x4+432x3+864x2+768x+256 Write the expression below under the form (a+b)n 16x4+96x3+216x2+216x+81 Tip Determine n Determine value of first term (a) Determine value of last term (b) Answer 5 terms ∴n=4 Isolate a a4=16x4 a=416x4​ a=2x Isolate b b4=81 b=3 ∴(2x+3)4 Homework Textbook p.

item.title: L3 - Arithmetic Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a sequence? A sequence is a list of numbers, figures, letters, etc. that are organized in a distinct and identifiable order Each number in a sequence is called a term.
